009package Ch02_Histograms_Statistics;
010
011import Ch03_PointOperations.Equalize_Histogram;
012import ij.IJ;
013import ij.ImagePlus;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * ImageJ plugin which calculates (and lists) the histogram of
020 * a 8-bit grayscale image. Alternatively the histogram could be 
021 * obtained with ImageJs built-in method (see also {@link Equalize_Histogram}):
022 * </p>
023 * <pre>
024 * int[] h = ip.getHistogram();</pre>
025 * <p>
026 * See Sec. 2.3 of [1] for additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
030 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 */
035public class Compute_Histogram implements PlugInFilter {
036
037        @Override
038        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
039                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES; 
040        }
041    
042        @Override
043        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
044                int[] h = new int[256];         // histogram array (initialized to zero values)
045                final int M  = ip.getWidth();
046                final int N = ip.getHeight();
047
048                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
049                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
050                                int i = ip.getPixel(u, v);
051                                h[i] = h[i] + 1;
052                        }
053                }
054                
055                // alternative to the above:
056                // int[] h = ip.getHistogram();
057
058                // ... histogram h[] may now be used
059                
060                // listing histogram values:
061                IJ.log("  i       h[i]");
062                for (int i = 0; i < h.length; i++) {
063                        IJ.log(String.format("%3d: %8d", i, h[i]));
064                }
065        }
066}
